HAL_SpiDescriptor_t Struct Reference

Spi descriptor. More...

#include <spi.h>

Data Fields

SpiChannel_t tty
 tty - SPI_CHANNEL_n to be used. "n" range depends on the platform. Take a look into halSpi.h platform specific file fore more details.
SpiClockMode_t clockMode
 SpiClockMode_t clockMode - spi clock mode (set by user). Must be chosen from:
SPI_CLOCK_MODE0
SPI_CLOCK_MODE1
SPI_CLOCK_MODE2
SPI_CLOCK_MODE3
.

 parameters are valid only for avr:
SpiBaudRate_t baudRate
 spi clock rate (set by user). Must be chosen from:
for atmega
SPI_CLOCK_RATE_62
SPI_CLOCK_RATE_125
SPI_CLOCK_RATE_250
SPI_CLOCK_RATE_500

HAL_UsartDescriptor_t spiDescriptor
 HAL USART service field - contains variables for HAL USART module internal needs.
union {
   void(*   callback )(void)
 address of the function to notify the application when a transmission was completed.
When the synchronous method is used, callback must be NULL.

   void(*   slave_callback )(uint16_t)
 address of the function to notify the application when a byte was received.
Slave mode uses only asynchronous method.

};

Spi descriptor.

Field Documentation

SpiDataOrder_t HAL_SpiDescriptor_t::dataOrder

parameters are valid only for avr:

spi data order (set by user). Must be chosen from:
SPI_DATA_MSB_FIRST
SPI_DATA_LSB_FIRST

Definition at line 76 of file spi.h.

SpiBaudRate_t HAL_SpiDescriptor_t::baudRate

spi clock rate (set by user). Must be chosen from:
for atmega
SPI_CLOCK_RATE_62
SPI_CLOCK_RATE_125
SPI_CLOCK_RATE_250
SPI_CLOCK_RATE_500

for xmega mcu clock
SPI_CLOCK_RATE_125 (4 MHz)
SPI_CLOCK_RATE_250 (4, 8 MHz)
SPI_CLOCK_RATE_500 (4, 8, 16 MHz)
SPI_CLOCK_RATE_750 (12 MHz )
SPI_CLOCK_RATE_1000 (4, 8, 16, 32 MHz)
SPI_CLOCK_RATE_1500 (12 MHz)
SPI_CLOCK_RATE_2000 (4, 8, 16, 32 MHz)
SPI_CLOCK_RATE_3000 (12 MHz)
SPI_CLOCK_RATE_4000 (8, 16, 32 MHz)
SPI_CLOCK_RATE_6000 (12 MHz)
SPI_CLOCK_RATE_8000 (16, 32 MHz)
SPI_CLOCK_RATE_16000 (32 MHz)
